org.epochx.ge.mapper
Class BreadthFirstMapper

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.ge.mapper.BreadthFirstMapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Mapper
public class BreadthFirstMapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements Mapper

A breadth first mapper is a twist on the classic depth-first mapper typically used by GE. It maps a GECandidateProgram's chromosome to a String by using each codon in order to choose between productions when constructing a derivation tree in breadth-first order.

It provides facility for wrapping and extending of chromosomes.

Method Detail

mapToString

public java.lang.String mapToString(GECandidateProgram program)
Perform the mapping operation.

Parameters:
program - the GECandidateProgram to be mapped to its source.
Returns:
a source string equivalent to the specified GECandidateProgram's chromosome after mapping using the model's grammar. Null is returned if a valid string could not be generated.

isWrapping

public boolean isWrapping()
Returns whether the wrapping operation is in use. If wrapping is being used then if there are insufficient codons during mapping then they will be wrapped, starting back at the first codon.

Returns:
true if codons will undergo wrapping, false otherwise.

setWrapping

public void setWrapping(boolean wrapping)
Specifies whether the wrapping operation should be used. If wrapping is turned on then when insufficient codons are available during mapping, the chromosome will be wrapped, starting again with the first codon.

Wrapping and extending are mutually exclusive. If one is set to be used then the other will automatically be turned off.

Parameters:
wrapping - whether wrapping should be used during mapping.

isExtending

public boolean isExtending()
Returns whether the extension operation is in use. If extending is being used then if there are insufficient codons during mapping then new codons will be generated using the models CodonGenerator and appended to the end of the program's chromosome. Extension will only occur up to the maximum chromosome length parameter specified in the model, after which programs will be considered illegal and the mapper will return null.

Returns:
true if codons will undergo extension, false otherwise.

setExtending

public void setExtending(boolean extending)
Specifies whether the extension operation should be used. If extension is turned on then when insufficient codons are available during mapping, the chromosome will be extended with a newly generated codon using the model's CodonGenerator. If the chromosome has already met the model's specified maximum length then the mapping operation will be abandoned and null will be returned to signal an invalid individual.

Parameters:
extending - whether extension should be used during mapping.

isRemovingUnusedCodons

public boolean isRemovingUnusedCodons()
Returns whether unused codons at the end of a chromosome are removed after mapping is complete.

Returns:
true if unused codons are currently being removed, false otherwise.

setRemovingUnusedCodons

public void setRemovingUnusedCodons(boolean remove)
Specifies whether unused codons at the end of a chromosome should be removed or not after the mapping operation is completed.

Parameters:
remove - whether unused codons should be removed or not.

getNoMappedCodons

public int getNoMappedCodons()
Returns the number of codons that were used in mapping the last GECandidateProgram to be mapped, or -1 if no CandidatePrograms have yet been mapped. The number of mapped codons constitutes the active portion of a chromosome and refers to the first n codons of the program.

Specified by:
getNoMappedCodons in interface Mapper
Returns:
the number of codons used during the last mapping process.

map

public NonTerminalSymbol map(GECandidateProgram program)
Description copied from interface: Mapper
Map the given GECandidateProgram to a parse tree.

Specified by:
map in interface Mapper
Parameters:
program - the program to be converted to a parse tree.
Returns:
a Symbol which is the root node of a valid parse tree, or null if no valid parse tree could be created from the GECandidateProgram.
